item.title: New version: system/nvtop version 2.0.3
item.description: Nvtop stands for NVidia TOP, a (h)top like task monitor for NVIDIA GPUs.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: biology/samtools version 1.16.1
item.description: Tools (written in C using htslib) for manipulating next-generation sequencing data.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: biology/bcftools version 1.16
item.description: BCFtools is a program for variant calling and manipulating files in the Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: biology/htslib version 1.16
item.description: C library for high-throughput sequencing data formats.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: biology/popscle version 0.1
item.description: popscle is a suite of population scale analysis tools for single-cell genomics data.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: system/google-cloud-sdk version 400.0.0
item.description: Command-line interface for Google Cloud Platform products and services.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: math/jags version 4.3.1
item.description: Just another Gibbs sampler (JAGS) is a program for simulation from Bayesian hierarchical models using Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC).
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: physics/geos version 3.11.0
item.description: GEOS (Geometry Engine - Open Source) is a C++ port of Java Topology Suite (JTS).
item.author: mthartma@stanford.edu (Mike Hartman)

item.title: New version: system/postgresql version 14.5
item.description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open source object-relational database system with a strong focus on reliability, feature robustness, and performance.
item.author: mthartma@stanford.edu (Mike Hartman)

item.title: New version: system/rclone version 1.59.1
item.description: Rclone is a command line program to sync files and directories to and from
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: biology/ants version 2.4.0
item.description: ANTs computes high-dimensional mappings to capture the statistics of brain structure and function.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: system/yaml-cpp version 0.7.0
item.description: yaml-cpp is a YAML parser and emitter in C++ matching the YAML 1.2 spec.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: biology/freesurfer version 7.3.2
item.description: An open source software suite for processing and analyzing (human) brain MRI images.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: devel/ruby version 3.1.2
item.description: A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: math/py-autograd version 1.0_py39
item.description: Autograd can automatically differentiate native Python and Numpy code.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: devel/py-mpi4py version 3.1.3_py39
item.description: MPI for Python provides Python bindings for the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard. It is implemented on top of the MPI-1/2/3 specification and exposes an API which grounds on the standard MPI-2 C++ bindings.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: devel/py-h5py version 3.7.0_py39
item.description: The h5py package is a Pythonic interface to the HDF5 binary data format.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: physics/mpb version 1.11.1
item.description: MPB is a free software package for computing the band structures, or dispersion relations, and electromagnetic modes of periodic dielectric structures, on both serial and parallel computers.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: devel/java version 18.0.2
item.description: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented,[14] and specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.
item.author: mthartma@stanford.edu (Mike Hartman)

item.title: New version: devel/java version 17.0.4
item.description: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented,[14] and specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

item.title: New version: devel/java version 12.0.2
item.description: Java is a general-purpose computer programming language that is concurrent, class-based, object-oriented,[14] and specifically designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.
item.author: mthartma@stanford.edu (Mike Hartman)

item.title: New version: devel/boost version 1.79.0
item.description: Boost is a set of libraries for the C++ programming language that provide support for tasks and structures such as linear algebra, pseudorandom number generation, multithreading, image processing, regular expressions, and unit testing.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: viz/pymol version 2.5.3

item.description: FRE-NCtools is a collection of tools to help with the creation and manipulation of netCDF files used for climate modeling.

item.title: New module: system/fribidi version 1.0.12
item.description: The Free Implementation of the Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: biology/dssp version 4.0.3
item.description: DSSP is an application to assign secondary structure to proteins.

item.description: Library to work with mmCIF and PDB files.

item.title: New module: system/mrc version 1.3.3
item.description: MRC is a resource compiler that can create self-contained applications, by including all the required data inside executable files.

item.title: New module: math/py-glum version 2.1.2_py39
item.description: glum is a fast, modern, Python-first GLM estimation library.

item.title: New module: math/py-tabmat version 3.1.2_py39
item.description: Efficient matrix representations for working with tabular data.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: system/jemalloc version 5.3.0
item.description: jemalloc is a general purpose malloc(3) implementation that emphasizes fragmentation avoidance and scalable concurrency support.

item.title: New module: devel/xsimd version 7.6.0
item.description: C++ wrappers for SIMD intrinsics and parallelized, optimized mathematical functions (SSE, AVX, NEON, AVX512)

item.description: C++ wrappers for SIMD intrinsics and parallelized, optimized mathematical functions (SSE, AVX, NEON, AVX512)

item.title: New version: math/R version 4.2.0
item.description: R is a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics.

item.title: New module: devel/netcdf-fortran version 4.5.4
item.description: NetCDF is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This module provides Fortran libraries.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: devel/netcdf-cxx version 4.3.1
item.description: NetCDF is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This module provides C++ libraries.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New module: devel/netcdf-c version 4.9.0
item.description: NetCDF is a set of software libraries and self-describing, machine-independent data formats that support the creation, access, and sharing of array-oriented scientific data. This module provides C libraries.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: devel/pnetcdf version 1.12.3
item.description: Parallel netCDF (PnetCDF) is a parallel I/O library for accessing NetCDF files in CDF-1, 2, and 5 formats.
item.author: kilian@stanford.edu (Kilian Cavalotti)

item.title: New version: chemistry/py-ase version 3.22.1_py39
item.description: The Atomic Simulation Environment (ASE) is a set of tools and Python modules for setting up, manipulating, running, visualizing and analyzing atomistic simulations.

item.title: New module: physics/py-megnet version 1.3.0_py39
item.description: The MatErials Graph Network (MEGNet) is an implementation of DeepMind's graph networks[1] for universal machine learning in materials science.

item.title: New module: physics/py-pymatgen version 2022.5.26_py39
item.description: Pymatgen (Python Materials Genomics) is a robust, open-source Python library for materials analysis.

item.title: New version: chemistry/py-rdkit version 2022.3.3_py39

item.title: New version: chemistry/quantum-espresso_gpu version 7.1
item.description: Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials.

item.title: New version: chemistry/quantum-espresso version 7.1
item.description: Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and pseudopotentials.
